content:
It's great to hear that you're taking proactive steps to prioritize your mental health! It's not an easy journey, but it's a crucial one. Recognizing the importance of mental health and seeking help is a huge step, and I'm proud of you for doing so.

Todoist and RescueTime are both excellent tools to help you manage your tasks and time more efficiently, which can also help reduce stress and anxiety. Todoist's task management features can help you break down overwhelming tasks into smaller, manageable chunks, while RescueTime's time tracking can help you identify areas where you can optimize your productivity and reduce distractions.

It's wonderful that you're exploring different coping mechanisms like meditation and yoga to help manage your anxiety and depression. Mindfulness practices can be incredibly powerful in reducing stress and increasing feelings of calm and relaxation. Regular exercise, like yoga, can also help reduce symptoms of anxiety and depression by releasing endorphins, also known as "feel-good" hormones.

Therapy is also a great resource to have in your corner. It's amazing that you've taken the step to seek professional help and are working with a therapist. They can provide you with personalized guidance, support, and tools to help you navigate your mental health journey.

Remember, taking care of your mental health is an ongoing process, and it's okay to take things one day at a time. Be kind to yourself, and don't hesitate to reach out for support when you need it. You're not alone in this journey, and there are many resources available to help you.

If you ever need someone to talk to or just want to share your experiences, I'm here to listen and offer support. Keep in mind that there are also many online resources and communities available, such as mental health forums, support groups, and hotlines, that can provide additional support and guidance.

Keep moving forward, and remember that you're doing the best you can. That's something to be proud of!
